Engine

Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • Engine.Vector2D

  • public class Vector2D
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple 2D vector class with basic geometric methods.

      • dot

        public float dot(Vector2D v)
        Returns the dot product of the current vector and another vector
        Parameters:
        v - - the vector to perform the dot product with
        Returns:
        the dot product (this.x*v.x + this.y*v.y)

      • scale

        public Vector2D scale(float s)
        Returns a new vector which is the scaled version of the current vector Scales by multiplying both components by the scalar
        Parameters:
        s - - the scaler to scale both components of the vector by
        Returns:
        a new Vector2D object which is the scaled version

      • scale

        public Vector2D scale(float x,
             float y)
        Returns a new vector which is the scaled version of the current vector Scales by multiplying both components by the scalars
        Parameters:
        x - - the x-component scalar
        y - - the y-component scalar
        Returns:
        a new Vector2D object which is the scaled version

      • thisScale

        public void thisScale(float x,
             float y)
        Scales the current vector by multiplying the x-component by one scaler and the y-component by another scalar
        Parameters:
        x - - the x-component scalar
        y - - the y-component scalar

      • length

        public float length()
        Returns the length of the current vector
        Returns:
        the length of the current vector

      • length2

        public float length2()
        Returns the length of the vector squared. In other words, dosn't perform the square root operation which is more efficient.
        Returns:

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Normalizes the current vector by dividing each component by the length. (i.e makes the current vector a unit vector)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Vector2D v)
        Checks the equality between the current vector and another vector
        Parameters:
        v - - the other vector to check equality with
        Returns:
        - true if they are equal, false if they are not

      • angle

        public float angle()
        Returns the angle of the current vector
        Returns:
        the angle in radians, the angle is between -pi and +pi. The exact orientation of the angle can be found in the documentation Appendix. But for short I will thisAdd it here: 
              |-90      
        180   |         
        ------------ 0  
        -180  |         
              |90

      • thisRotate

        public void thisRotate(float radians)
        Rotates the current vector by the given angle,using the same angle convention
        Parameters:
        radians - the amount of radians to rotate by

      • rotate

        public Vector2D rotate(float radians)
        Rotates the current vector by the given angle and returns the new vector
        Parameters:
        radians - the amount of radians to rotate by
        Returns:
        the newly rotated vector

      • angle

        public float angle(Vector2D v)
        Returns the angle between two vectors. Using the same angle convention.
        Parameters:
        v - - the vector to find the angle between
        Returns:
        the angle in radians

      • getPerpendicular

        public Vector2D getPerpendicular()
        Returns a new vector which is perpendicular to the current vector. Returns an outward facing vector for a "clockwise" oriented vector.
        Returns:
        the perpendicular vector

      • bounceNormal

        public Vector2D bounceNormal(Vector2D normal)
        Returns a new vector which is reflected with the given normal.

        For more information look in the documentation appendix.

        Uses r = d - ((2* d (dot) n)/|n|^2)*n to calculate the reflection vector

        Parameters:
        normal - the normal of the reflecting surface
        Returns:
        the reflection vector

      • thisBounceNormal

        public void thisBounceNormal(Vector2D normal)
        Reflect the current vector with the given normal.

        For more information look in the documentation appendix.

        Uses r = d - ((2* d (dot) n)/|n|^2)*n to calculate the reflection vector

        Parameters:
        normal - the normal of the reflecting surface
